result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodrigo Salgado-Cardona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time, legal, verifiable employment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations, including $141.00 in outstanding ZCI (Zimmerman Consulting Inc) testing and monitoring fees.  Do not enter or be in the United States without proper documentation of lawful presence.  Reprot any changes in immigration status to probation agent.  Contact probation or parole agent within 24 hours of release from ICE custody within the United States.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

From Atty Kuehn req 1 week adj of PH
Lori Kuehn
Preliminary hearing on July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rodrigo Salgado-Cardona in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Rodrigo Salgado-Cardona in custody.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Interpreter, Albert Aquilar, appeared on behalf of the defendant.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
